headline: Olive Garden Parent’s Stock Is Slumping Amid Tariff Woes. Executives Are Making Sales.
summary: Darden Restaurants  the parent company of Olive Garden and LongHorn Steakhouse, was once considered a winner in the fast-casual dining category.  Matt Broad, the company’s senior vice president, general counsel, and corporate secretary, was the first executive to sell company shares this month, records show.  On Oct. 6, Broad sold 5,661 shares of common stock at an average price of $193.40 each, or around $1.1 million in total, according to a Form 4 filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
